title: Where will the low-skilled jobs be in the future? - Quora

response.answer_text: This can be quite depressing over time. Low-skilled jobs will definitely be greatly reduced as they will be replace by AI, Automation and Technology. Therefore it is wise that you start to embrace digital to learn skillset that allows you to qualify for the new job economy after the present Covid-19 pandemic. More companies will start to operate online and leverage on tools that will enhance their business operation from now on. They will also learn how to generate traffic online via advertisements, social media and other methodology therefore if you have skills that can support their requirements your chances of getting the job is greatly enhanced. However, if you learn those skillsets well, you can even provide freelancing services to your local businesses for a fee. Then you can learn to earn the kind of income you want for yourself. Therefore its a win-win if you start to embrace digital today.

There seems to be a trend where even the low skilled jobs requirement are going up. Such jobs are likely going to be the jobs which machines cannot do. For example, in making a T-shirt, a machine can harvest the cotton, and make it into filaments and tissues, without the requirement of a single worker. However, the job becomes more complicated when it comes to crop the tissues and making it into the actual T-shirt, thus machines can’t do that job. This is a nice analogy for what are going to be future jobs for low skilled people. They are just going to do whatever the machines can’t do, which, with the progress in AI and technology, less and less jobs will be left for unspecialised workers.
